content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>US Fish Wildlife Service, Region 5, Refuges and Wildlife Division, Realty Office, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch, Hadley, Massachusetts</origin> <pubdate>20000711</pubdate> <title>Canaan Valley National Wildlife Refuge Boundary Data</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Hadley, Massachusetts</pubplace> <publish>US Fish and Wildlife Service</publish> </pubinfo> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>National Wildlife Refuges are federal lands managed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWS). The primary source for boundary information is the USFWS Realty program (status maps, legal surveys). An effort by the USFWS Region 5 (northeast states - ME, NH,VT, MA, RI, CT, NY, PA, NJ, MD, DE, WV, VA) Realty Division, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch has resulted in digital refuge boundaries for all refuges in the northeast at a scale of 1:24,000.</abstract> <purpose>The intended application of the data is to serve as a spatial reference of refuge boundaries for other data layers in GIS and mapping applications. It is specifically not intended to be used as a land survey or representation of land for conveyance or tax purposes. For Survey data, please contact USFWS, Region 5, Realty Office, Surveys Branch.</purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20000711</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-79.456528</westbc> <eastbc>-79.321493</eastbc> <northbc>39.182065</northbc> <southbc>39.005032</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>boundaries</themekey> <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey> <themekey>environment</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>None.</themekt> <themekey>National Wildlife Refuge boundary</themekey> <themekey>wildlife refuge</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Canaan Valley NWR</placekey> <placekey>Ohio River Islands NWR</placekey> </place> <stratum> <stratkt>None</stratkt> <stratkey>surface</stratkey> </stratum> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>Refuge boundary data were compiled for resource applications. It is inappropriate to use these data in legal situations, or other applications where spatial error cannot exceed the USGS 7.5-minute mapping standards.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>US Fish Wildlife Service, Realty Office, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Supervisory Cartographer</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>US Fish & Wildlife Service, Realty 300 Westgate Center Dr.</address> <city>Hadley</city> <state>MA</state> <postal>01035</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(413) 253-8292</cntvoice> <cntfax>(413) 253-8451</cntfax> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <native>Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 1381) Service Pack 5; ESRI ArcInfo 8.0.345</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Digital refuge boundaries are plotted with arc and polygon attributes, then compared to USFWS Realty status maps, survey documents, and collateral information for coding accuracy. Three levels of quality-control review are conducted (Cartography and Spatial Data Services, Realty Management Branch, Refuge Staff) with corrections being incorporated after each review until the dataset is deemed error-free. See "Service Lands Boundary Data Standard Operating Procedure".</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>All polygons are closed and adjusted to the most accurate geographic features, usually on a USGS 7.5' topographic quad. All dangling arcs, undershoots, and overshoots have been removed.</logic> <complete>All boundaries were digitized for exterior fee-titled, USFWS owned lands, acquired tracts, and areas approved for USFWS acquisition. Plots are generated and quality-control reviewed for omission and commission digitizing errors.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Digital refuge boundaries are verified against USGS 1:24,000-scale,7.5' DLG, DRG, or 1:12,000-scale DOQQ data such as roads, hydrography, or plotted at 1:24,000 scale and overlayed on USGS 7.5' maps. Data are stored in ArcInfo double precision.</horizpar> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>YSFWS, Region 5, Refuges and Wildlife Division, Realty Office</origin> <pubdate>197706</pubdate> <title>Canaan Valley NWR Status Map</title> <geoform>map</geoform> <serinfo> <sername>National Wildlife Refuge Status Maps</sername> <issue>N/A</issue> </serinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Hadley, Massachusetts</pubplace> <publish>USFWS</publish> </pubinfo> </citeinfo> </srccite> <srcscale>24000</srcscale> <typesrc>mylar</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>197706</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <srccurr>publication date</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>RE status map</srccitea> <srccontr>status information</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>Status maps were registered to geographic coordinates, boundaries were digitized and labeled. Digital files were updated using survey and collateral data, then stepped through 3 levels of quality-control review for spatial and thematic accuracy. Complete process description can be found in "Service Lands Boundary Data SOP".</procdesc> <srcused>RE Status Map</srcused> <procdate>20000711</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <direct>Vector</direct> <ptvctinf> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Complete chain</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>87</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Entity point</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>35</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>GT-polygon composed of chains</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>35</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Point</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>4</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> </ptvctinf> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn>Transverse Mercator</mapprojn> <transmer> <sfctrmer>0.999600</sfctrmer> <longcm>-81.000000</longcm> <latprjo>0.000000</latprjo> <feast>500000.000000</feast> <fnorth>0.000000</fnorth> </transmer> </mapproj> <planci> <plance>coordinate pair</plance> <coordrep> <absres>0.000016</absres> <ordres>0.000016</ordres> </coordrep> <plandu>meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>North American Datum of 1983</horizdn> <ellips>Clarke 1866</ellips> <semiaxis>6378206.400000</semiaxis> <denflat>294.978698</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>Refuge boundaries define areas that are approved by the U.S. Congress for acquisition into the National Wildlife Refuge System, or are currently owned by USFWS. Arcs are coded with an item "boundary"with the type of boundary line; polygons are coded with an item "status" that describes their ownership status. See "Service Lands Boundary Data SOP."</eaover> <eadetcit>no information</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>USFWS, Region 5, Realty Office, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Supervisory Cartographer</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>US Fish and Wildlife Service, Realty 300 Westgate Center Dr.</address> <city>Hadley</city> <state>MA</state> <postal>01035</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(413) 253-8292</cntvoice> <cntfax>(413) 253-8451</cntfax> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>USFWS National Wildlife Refuge Boundary Data</resdesc> <distliab>None</distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>ARCE</formname> <filedec>No compression applied</filedec> <transize>0.052</transize> </digtinfo> <digtopt> <onlinopt> <computer> <networka> <networkr>northeast.fws.gov/gis</networkr> </networka> </computer> </onlinopt> </digtopt> </digform> <fees>None</fees> <ordering>northeast.fws.gov/gis Select "Data Download"; "NWR Boundaries", state name, refuge name</ordering> </stdorder> <availabl> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20000711</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> </availabl> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20000711</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Linda Shaffer</cntper> <cntorg>US Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 5, Realty, Cartography and Spatial Data Services Branch</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>Supervisory Cartographer</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>US Fish and Wildlife Service, Realty 300 Westgate Center Dr.</address> <city>Hadley</city> <state>MA</state> <postal>01035</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(413) 253-8292</cntvoice> <cntfax>(413) 253-8451</cntfax> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn> <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv> <mettc>local time</mettc> <metac>None</metac> <metuc>None</metuc> <metextns> <onlink><http://www.esri.com/metadata/esriprof80.html></onlink> <metprof>ESRI Metadata Profile</metprof> </metextns> </metainfo> </metadata>
